title: The cute moment you didn't notice in Harry and Meghan's new documentary
text:
From Cosmopolitan

Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's new documentary, Harry and Meghan: An African Journey, aired last night on ITV – and as well as featuring emotional joint and solo interviews with both royals (including one where Meghan discusses how the British tabloids have impacted her mental health), eagle-eyed fans spotted a super cute behind-the-scenes moment.



Naturally, it involved their adorable five-month-old baby boy, Archie Mountbatten-Windsor.

While filming a candid chat with Meghan, all about how moving and inspiring she's found her trip to southern Africa so far, filmmakers caught Prince Harry rocking his son to sleep and giving him a big old cuddle in the reflection of a nearby glass window. So sweet!

It seems the little one has really taken a shine to the country too, as Harry also later says, "He [Archie] was looking out the window. He has found his voice now and he was bouncing up and down. He was making more noise than he has ever made before and he is smiling the whole time."

Photo credit: Getty Images More

One fan on Twitter even said spotting the intimate off-camera moment was her favourite part of the documentary.

My favourite part of Harry & Meghan: An African Journey. Reflection of Harry cuddling Archie #HarryAndMeghan #itnproductions pic.twitter.com/dhzGM3tUUV — Emma Wood (@EmmalWood) October 20, 2019

Others said they couldn't keep their eyes off of the charming interaction, by tweeting, "Meghan is saying something important but I can't keep my eyes off the duo in the left side corner.....Harry and Archie"

Meghan is saying something important but I can't keep my eyes off the duo in the left side corner.....Harry and Archie 😍#HarryandMeghan pic.twitter.com/eEh9d1Aoib — Aly Brendan (@AlyBrendan) October 20, 2019

Also in the documentary, Prince Harry discusses his relationship with brother (and future king), Prince William, saying that the pair are on "different paths" but will still always "be there for each other".



Harry said: "We don't see each other as much as we used to as we are so busy. But I love him dearly and you know the majority of the stuff [rumours of a rift] is probably — well, the majority of the stuff is created out of nothing. But as brothers, you have good days and you have bad days."



If you didn't manage to catch the programme last night, it's still available on ITV Player for 29 more days.
